page.title: 04EASTLEIGH ENVIRONMENT
page.content: In 1948,the 140 hectares of{Stoke {Park Wood}was bought by the Forestry Commission.In 1086 it was worth Â£8.It is planted with{Japenese Larch,Western {Hemlock,Beech}with natural regrowth of {Oak,Silver Birch,Sweet Chestnut}and{ {Ash}giving various habitat levels for 150+ species of plants,65+ species of fungi,51+ species of birds and 19+ species of animals. The{River Itchen}and the Water Meadows plays host to{Trout,Grayling, {Kingfisher,Water Rail,Otter}and as a winter roost for{Golden Plover. The area known as{Allington Lane {Fisheries}was originally a gravel pit, then a trout hatchery/fishery and now privately owned.It has a large area of {Orchids,}and is an important site for wintering wild fowl{Mallard,Tufted {Duck,Pochard,Gadwall,Shoveler,Smew, {Teal,Wigeon}and{Canada Goose.
